column4: you are not being clear on what you are wanting to do  either
with SSH can I still use graphic apps?
what doies icewm have to do with it? open up a terminal, ssh remoteipmachine
unless you want some other type of remote connection
I want the IceWM machine to be the server.
Icewm has nothing to do with being a 'server' Unless you are referiong to being a vncdesktop server. Install the services you want to serve
I tried to read the tutorials, they are confusing.
this is all new to me
The IceWM computer is the server.  I want it secured with SSH.  I want to be able to access it over the Internet using Windows.
if you want ssh access.. then install the sshd server/service -  then you can use putty and winscp and xming on windows to access the server
you can install 'xming' on the windows box and get it set where  the linux apps appear on the windows machine via ssh - yes
okay, then how do I start SSH on the IceWM box, please?
install the ssh service
I am still lost... :(
an .img of what exactly?
of Windows 98 for QEMU.  Soreau: (franco?) it becomes big or small depending on the files in it.  QCow.
try converting it to iso perhaps. I dont even recall what makes 'img' files..
or do  You mean its a hard drive IMAGE file ? not an optical disk image file?
qemu-img on the command line.
I thought qemu used 'raw image' files.  Not sure what other programs you want to access it with. Ive rarely used qemu.
qemu-img convert -c -f raw -O qcow2 win98.img win98q.img
